alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 3:17PM EDT until June 06 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain have ended over the advisory area. However, 1 to 2 inches of rainfall has occurred over the area from the earlier heavy rains. This amount on rainfall will take some time to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 415 PM EDT this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Homestead, The Redland, Kendall, Homestead General Airport, Sweetwater, Florida City, Richmond West, Country Walk, The Hammocks, Zoo Miami, Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive, Goulds, The Crossings, Princeton, Richmond Heights, West Kendall, Naranja, West Perrine, Leisure City and Kendale Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
